definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: She tries to back track, but the President simply walks away.
sentences.chinese: 她試圖重新回到話題，但總統一言不發地走開了。

sentences.english: She turned and flung out without a word.
sentences.chinese: 她轉過身，一言不發就憤然離開了。

sentences.english: As Palmer hugs his daughter, Sherry passes him without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 帕默擁抱着他的女兒，雪莉一言不發地從他身邊走過。

sentences.english: He led her home, but she did not speak a single word the whole way.
sentences.chinese: 然後王子領着新娘回去了，可一路上新娘卻一言不發。

sentences.english: The Queen of Scots was silent. She stood like a stone.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格蘭女王一言不發，像座石像一樣站在那裏。

sentences.english: As Palmer hugs his daughter Sherry passes him without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 帕默擁抱着他的女兒，雪莉一言不發地從他身邊走過。

sentences.english: Mr. Darcy said very little, and Mr. Hurst nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 達西先生說話不多，赫斯脫先生完全一言不發。

sentences.english: Without a word, she turned and swept out.
sentences.chinese: 她一言不發，轉過身昂着頭走了出去。

sentences.english: CEO After reading our mouths shut, locking it into the drawer.
sentences.chinese: 總裁看了以後，一言不發，把它鎖進抽屜。

sentences.english: "Without uttering a word, they got through to the decision-maker," Diamond explains.
sentences.chinese: “他們一言不發地直接找到了決策者，”戴蒙解釋到。

sentences.english: Full of tender feelings, she gazes at Xiao Wang, and says nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她一言不發，只是溫情脈脈地注視着小王。

sentences.english: Fishing out his pipe, he filled it and puffed at it without a word.
sentences.chinese: 他掏出菸斗，裝滿菸絲，一言不發地抽了起來。

sentences.english: But I said nothing because I didn't like this strange house.
sentences.chinese: 但是我一言不發，因爲我並不喜歡陌生的房子。

sentences.english: This funster is examining this canvas silent as the gravely.
sentences.chinese: 這位幽默家一言不發地審視着這幅油畫。

sentences.english: The executioner put down his axe and stood quietly.
sentences.chinese: 劊子手放下了斧子，一言不發地站着。

definition: to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
